message:
When I connected an iphone, a Samsung galaxy phone and a Vodafone USB at the same time, The iphone is way faster. I used Ookla speed test the and iphone speed is 11 MB/s.

I think Vodafone are really giving precedence to the iphone, instead of this being a hardware limitation on the Samsung/USB modem. The Ookla test on the USB modem yields 4.5 MB/s, although in good conditions it should be around 7.5 MB/s (like very late at night).

Did anyone else notice this?

data.message: That's weird ... I never thought vendors will do something like that with hardware too ... net neutrality FTW
Or it could be just that iPhone hardware is getting better signal? Getting full bars is not an indication of your 3G connection speed strength by any mean

iPhones are pretty much known to have bad radio-frequency performance because of their small sizes and metal casing. If this is happening then it must be because Vodafone is somehow throttling performance on the Samsung phone. Check out this link: http://www.gsmarena.com/apple_iphone_6s_reception_tested_results_come_out_pretty_bad-blog-14677.php

EDIT: here's a recent discussion on the t-mobile subreddit regarding this: https://www.reddit.com/r/tmobile/comments/3uupon/iphone_6s_vs_galaxy_s6note_5_reception/
